com.evernote.android.job

Class JobRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.evernote.android.job.JobRequest

  • public final class JobRequest
extends Object
    Holds information about the pending Job. Use the JobRequest.Builder to create an instance. Once built you can either call schedule() or JobManager.schedule(JobRequest) to schedule the request.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  JobRequest.Builder
      Builder class for constructing JobRequests.
      static interface  JobRequest.JobScheduledCallback
      Callback that is used when scheduling a JobRequest asynchronously on a background thread.
      static class  JobRequest.NetworkType

      • DEFAULT_BACKOFF_MS

        public static final long DEFAULT_BACKOFF_MS
        If you don't change the back-off ms, then 30 seconds are used as default.
        See Also:
        Builder#setBackoffCriteria(long, BackoffPolicy), Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_BACKOFF_POLICY

        public static final JobRequest.BackoffPolicy DEFAULT_BACKOFF_POLICY
        If you don't change the back-off policy, then EXPONENTIAL is used as default.
        See Also:
        Builder#setBackoffCriteria(long, BackoffPolicy)

      • DEFAULT_NETWORK_TYPE

        public static final JobRequest.NetworkType DEFAULT_NETWORK_TYPE
        If you don't change the required network type, then no connection is required.
        See Also:
        Builder#setRequiredNetworkType(NetworkType), JobRequest.Builder.setRequirementsEnforced(boolean)

      • DEFAULT_JOB_SCHEDULED_CALLBACK

        public static final JobRequest.JobScheduledCallback DEFAULT_JOB_SCHEDULED_CALLBACK
        The default callback that is used when you schedule a JobRequest asynchronously in scheduleAsync(). This implementation only logs a message in case of a failure and doesn't crash.

      • MIN_INTERVAL

        public static final long MIN_INTERVAL
        The minimum interval of a periodic job. Specifying a smaller interval will result in an exception.

        This limit comes from the JobScheduler starting with Android Nougat. You can read here more about the limit.
        See Also:
        JobRequest.Builder.setPeriodic(long), JobRequest.Builder.setPeriodic(long, long)

      • MIN_FLEX

        public static final long MIN_FLEX
        The minimum flex of a periodic job. Specifying a smaller flex will result in an exception.

        This limit comes from the JobScheduler starting with Android Nougat. You can read here more about the limit.
        See Also:
        JobRequest.Builder.setPeriodic(long, long)

      • START_NOW

        static final long START_NOW
        See Also:

public String getTag()

      • getStartMs

        public long getStartMs()
        Only valid if the job isn't periodic.
        Returns:
        The start of the time frame when the job will run after it's been scheduled.

      • getEndMs

        public long getEndMs()
        Only valid if the job isn't periodic.
        Returns:
        The end of the time frame when the job will run after it's been scheduled.

      • getBackoffPolicy

        public JobRequest.BackoffPolicy getBackoffPolicy()
        Only valid if the job isn't periodic.
        Returns:
        The back-off policy if a job failed and is rescheduled.

      • getBackoffMs

        public long getBackoffMs()
        Only valid if the job isn't periodic.
        Returns:
        The initial back-off time which is increasing depending on the getBackoffPolicy() if the job fails multiple times.

      • isPeriodic

        public boolean isPeriodic()
        Returns:
        Whether this job is periodic.

      • getIntervalMs

        public long getIntervalMs()
        Only valid if the job is periodic.
        Returns:
        The interval in which the job runs once.

      • getFlexMs

        public long getFlexMs()
        Flex time for this job. Only valid if this is a periodic job. The job can execute at any time in a window of flex length at the end of the period.
        Returns:
        How close to the end of an interval a periodic job is allowed to run.

      • requirementsEnforced

        public boolean requirementsEnforced()
        Returns:
        If true, then all requirements are checked before the job runs. If one requirement isn't met, then the job is rescheduled right away.

      • requiresCharging

        public boolean requiresCharging()
        Returns:
        If true, then the job should only run if the device is charging.

      • requiresDeviceIdle

        public boolean requiresDeviceIdle()
        Returns:
        If true, then the job should only run if the device is idle.

      • requiresBatteryNotLow

        public boolean requiresBatteryNotLow()
        Returns:
        If true, then the job should only run if the battery isn't low.

      • requiresStorageNotLow

        public boolean requiresStorageNotLow()
        Returns:
        If true, then the job should only run if the battery isn't low.

      • requiredNetworkType

        public JobRequest.NetworkType requiredNetworkType()
        Returns:
        The network state which is required to run the job.

      • hasRequirements

        public boolean hasRequirements()
        Returns:
        Whether any of the requirements is different than the default value.

      • getExtras

        public PersistableBundleCompat getExtras()
        Returns:
        The extras for this job.

      • isUpdateCurrent

        public boolean isUpdateCurrent()
        Returns:
        If true, then this request will overwrite any preexisting jobs.

      • isExact

        public boolean isExact()
        Returns:
        If true, then the job will run at exact time ignoring the device state.

      • getJobApi

      • setScheduledAt

        void setScheduledAt(long timeStamp)

      • getScheduledAt

        public long getScheduledAt()
        Returns the time when this job was scheduled.

        Note that this value is only useful for non-periodic jobs. The time for periodic jobs is inconsistent. Sometimes it will return the value when the periodic job was scheduled for the first time and sometimes it will be updated after each period. The reason for this limitation is the flex parameter, which was backported to older Android versions. You can only rely on this value during the first interval of the periodic job.
        Returns:
        The time when the job was scheduled.

      • getFailureCount

        public int getFailureCount()
        The failure count increases if a non periodic Job was rescheduled or if a periodic Job wasn't successful.
        Returns:
        How often the job already has failed.

      • isStarted

        boolean isStarted()
        Only non-periodic jobs can be in a started state. The started state means, that the job is running and is about to be removed. A job can get stuck in a started state, if the app terminates while the job is running. Then the job isn't scheduled anymore, but the entry is still in the database. Since the job didn't finish successfully, reschedule the job if necessary and treat it as it wouldn't have run, yet.
        Returns:
        Whether the job is in a started state.

      • isFlexSupport

        boolean isFlexSupport()

      • setFlexSupport

        void setFlexSupport(boolean flexSupport)

      • getLastRun

        public long getLastRun()
        Returns the time the job did run the last time. This is only useful for periodic jobs, daily jobs or jobs which were rescheduled. If the job didn't run, yet, then it returns 0.
        Returns:
        The last time the rescheduled or periodic job did run.

      • isTransient

        public boolean isTransient()
        Returns whether this is a transient jobs. WARNING: It's not guaranteed that a transient job will run at all, e.g. rebooting the device or force closing the app will cancel the job.
        Returns:
        If this is a transient job.

      • getTransientExtras

        @NonNull
public Bundle getTransientExtras()
        Returns the transient extras you passed in when constructing this job with JobRequest.Builder.setTransientExtras(Bundle). WARNING: It's not guaranteed that a transient job will run at all, e.g. rebooting the device or force closing the app will cancel the job.

        This will never be null. If you did not set any extras this will be an empty bundle. The returned bundle will also be empty, if the request isn't cached anymore.
        Returns:
        The transient extras you passed in when constructing this job.

      • schedule

        public int schedule()
        Schedule a request which will be executed in the future. If you want to update an existing JobRequest, call cancelAndEdit(), update your parameters and call this method again. Calling this method on the same request instance multiple times without cancelling is idempotent.

        Convenience method. Internally it calls JobManager.schedule(JobRequest) and getJobId() for this request.
        Returns:
        The unique ID for this job.

      • scheduleAsync

        public void scheduleAsync()
        Helper method to schedule a request on a background thread. This is helpful to avoid IO operations on the main thread.

        In case of a failure an error is logged, but the application doesn't crash.

      • scheduleAsync

        public void scheduleAsync(@NonNull
                          JobRequest.JobScheduledCallback callback)
        Helper method to schedule a request on a background thread. This is helpful to avoid IO operations on the main thread. The callback notifies you about the job ID or a possible failure.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback which is invoked after the request has been scheduled.

      • cancelAndEdit

        public JobRequest.Builder cancelAndEdit()
        Cancel this request if it has been scheduled. Note that if the job isn't periodic, then the time passed since the job has been scheduled is subtracted from the time frame. For example a job should run between 4 and 6 seconds from now. You cancel the scheduled job after 2 seconds, then the job will run between 2 and 4 seconds after it's been scheduled again.
        Returns:
        A builder to modify the parameters.
